page.title: 11HEALE HOUSE, WOODFORD
page.content: Heale House is five miles North of Salisbury and is owned by Major D.A.C.Rasch. The house is built of pink brick. There are eight acres of garden and the River Avon runs through the garden and estate. There are also 3000 acres of land that belong to the estate, where wheat is mostly grown and sheep graze. Heale House is extremely well hidden from the road, in fact you can only see the chimneys. The house is situated in the Woodford Valley. King Charles II hid in the house and no one knows to this day where he was hidden. The garden is open to the public from Easter to September. It is a plant centre for unusual plants and shrubs and roses. There is a water garden , a Japanese bridge and a tea house made of rice paper. People from the village come to work in the gardens.
